oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Bon Air Coal and Iron Corporation
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Bon Air Coal and Iron Corporation that shows the railroad train engine 'Jake Ruppert' and a coal car in front of the offices.

In 1897, the Bon Air Coal, Land and Lumber Company purchased the Buffalo Iron Company in Hickman County, Tennessee, and changed its name to the Bon Air Coal and Iron Company. Because of World War I, demands for coal in 1917 had increased and attracted new investors in the White County coal company. In July, William J. Cummins bought the Bon Air Coal and Iron Company including over 50,000 acres of land at a receiver's sale in Nashville. The company's name changed to the Bon Air Coal and Iron Corporation.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:source: Looking Back at Tennessee Photograph Collection, 1890-1981
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Trees; Offices; Railroad trains; Coal; Smoke; Railroad cars; Buildings
